member.name: IAMGraphStreams.FindUpstreamInterface

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The FindUpstreamInterface method searches the filter graph for a specified interface, upstream from a specified pin.

member.param: Pointer to the interface of a pin. The pin must belong to a filter in the filter graph.
Reference to an interface identifier (IID) that specifies the interface to find.
Address of a void pointer. If the method succeeds, this variable receives a pointer to the interface specified by riid.
Combination of flags from the enumeration, specifying what to search (pins or filters).

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

member.name: IAMGraphStreams.SetMaxGraphLatency

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SetMaxGraphLatency method sets the maximum latency for the graph. You must call the method before calling this method.

member.param: Specifies the maximum latency in 100-nanosecond units.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

member.name: IAMGraphStreams.SyncUsingStreamOffset

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SyncUsingStreamOffset method enables or disables synchronization using time-stamp offsets.

member.param: Boolean value indicating whether to use a time-stamp offset. If TRUE, live sources will use a time-stamp offset to synchronize streams.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, or an error code otherwise.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]

The IAMGraphStreams interface controls a filter graph that renders a live source. A live source is one that streams data in real time, such as a capture device or a network broadcast. The Filter Graph Manager implements this interface.
Applications can use this interface to specify how the graph handles latency and synchronization when it renders a live source. For more information, see Live Sources.
